definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Yao/Yao or Tang Yao (c. 2200 BC), one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], second son of Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4]

sentences.english: Fixation pins were placed in the 2 3 metacarpal and radial shaft.
sentences.chinese: 外固定針固定在2～3掌骨和橈骨幹上。

sentences.english: Moment arms of the flexor carpi radialis tendon showed a consistent increase during wrist motion. Conclusion?
sentences.chinese: 橈側腕屈肌腱在腕屈伸或尺橈偏時均顯著增大。

sentences.english: Copepods are small and funny looking one eyed crustaceans.
sentences.chinese: 橈足類是尋找一個有趣的小眼睛的甲殼類動物。

sentences.english: There is a report in the literature on flying copepods .
sentences.chinese: 有這麼一篇文章是關於能夠飛翔的橈足動物的。

sentences.english: Copepods are microscopic relatives of shrimp and lobsters.
sentences.chinese: 橈腳類動物是蝦和龍蝦的親戚關係在顯微鏡下。

sentences.english: Some essential nutrients necessary for reproduction of copepods are insufficient in diatom cells.
sentences.chinese: 高濃度硅藻對橈足類繁殖的抑制機制。

sentences.english: The fastest of the recovered is Protozan after it is damaged, and the most slow is Copepoda.
sentences.chinese: 受損傷後恢復最快的最原生動物，最慢的是橈足類。

sentences.english: Objective To probe into the clinical feasibility of blood sampling from radial vein.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討橈靜脈採血方法在臨牀上的應用價值。

sentences.english: It was the antechamber of the galleys.
sentences.chinese: 這裏是大橈船的接待室。

sentences.english: Objective To study the causes and outcome of humeral fracture associated with radial nerve injury.
sentences.chinese: 目的分析肱骨骨折伴橈神經損傷的病因及治療結果。

sentences.english: Cladocerans and copepods are two important components in freshwater zooplankton.
sentences.chinese: 枝角類和橈足類是淡水浮游動物的主要組成部分。

sentences.english: Objective To study the range and change of stress in normal radiocarpal joint.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究正常橈腕關節內應力分佈及其變化規律。

sentences.english: They are usually a bit bigger than Copepods.
sentences.chinese: 他們通常比橈足類的大一點。

definition: to shape on a lathe/to peel with a knife/to turn in (a screw)
ancient unit of weight equal to 20 or 24 liang 兩|两[liang3]
